global_flags.description: mount all filesystems mentioned in fstab
mount a subtree somewhere else (same as -o bind)
dry run; skip the mount(2) syscall
fork off for each device (use with -a)
recursively mark a whole subtree as private
recursively mark a whole subtree as shared
recursively mark a whole subtree as slave
recursively mark a whole subtree as unbindable
move a subtree to some other place
check if filesystem is already mounted
mount a subtree and all submounts somewhere else
mount the filesystem read-only (same as -o ro)
limit the set of filesystems (use with -a)
limit the set of filesystem types

synonym for UUID=<uuid> LABEL=<label> specifies device by filesystem label UUID=<uuid> specifies device by filesystem UUID PARTLABEL=<label> specifies device by partition label PARTUUID=<uuid> specifies device by partition UUID ID=<id> specifies device by udev hardware ID <device> specifies device by path <directory> mountpoint for bind mounts (see --bind/rbind) <file> regular file for loopdev setup
